answerText: Clausius-Clapeyron equation[10] The Clausius-Clapeyron equation can be easily derived as a consequence of this equation, which gives the sum of the products of moles and increments of chemical potential as equivalent to volume times the differential of pressure minus entropy times the differential of temperature.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Editor's Packet 1 | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In its canonical form, this equation expresses the logarithm of the pressure as proportional to enthalpy and inversely proportional to temperature. For ten points each: [10] ] Identify this equation, which gives the coexistence curves in PT space between different phases.
